comments:
Hi Mikhail,

I got the following NPE when I ran ManagedBuildCoreTests20.testExtensions().  If you can take a look at it that'd be great!  Thanks!

Vivian

Hi Miwako,

I'm not seeing this exception. I guess the NPE might be caused by Intel compiler tool definitions.

I would need to update my Intel Compiler plug-ins in order to test that.

Mikhail

(In reply to comment #1)
Oops, sorry Vivian :), I somehow mixed up with bug reporters, please sorry about that :-)

In any way I can not reproduce your issue with the default CDT installation. Does your configuration contain some customized tool-chain integrations? At first glance it seems that there exists some extension folderInfo definition that does not contain a toolChain within it. Could you check that?

Thanks,
Mikhail

Hmm I can't reproduce it anymore.  Will mark it as invalid.

Thanks Mikhail!

I'm getting all sorts of test failures in the managed core tests. They actually crash eclipse on the build machine. I've done a few fixes to get them to run on Windows without hanging (due to some bad cygpath interactions). I'm not sure it's just my machine, since I don't have cygwin in my path.

(In reply to comment #4)
> I'm getting all sorts of test failures in the managed core tests. They actually
> crash eclipse on the build machine. I've done a few fixes to get them to run on
> Windows without hanging (due to some bad cygpath interactions). I'm not sure
> it's just my machine, since I don't have cygwin in my path.
I was also getting multiple tests failing until I installed cygwin. It seems that some tests assume that the gcc tool-chain is installed, although I didn't have time to investigate that yet

(In reply to comment #5)
> I was also getting multiple tests failing until I installed cygwin. It seems
> that some tests assume that the gcc tool-chain is installed, although I didn't
> have time to investigate that yet
Yeah, some tests seem to expect, e.g. the .d files are generated and fail on checking those files. BTW this happens with 3.1.2 as well.
We should fix this, but probably not for the 4.0.1
